intro: Corispermum bjelorussicum, commonly known as the Belarusian corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is a low-growing, annual herb characterized by its succulent stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. It is native to the temperate regions of Eastern Europe and is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Due to its adaptability, it is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
